title: Chief Technology Officer
shortDescription:
- Own technology vision, architecture, and execution as the company scales platform + AI products.
- Partner with CEO/leadership on roadmap, resourcing, and technical strategy.
- Lead engineering org and drive delivery, reliability, and security practices.
- Focused on applied AI + data platforms for customer impact.
fitRationale:
- Matches your enterprise AI/platform leadership strengths, especially if you want a tighter CEO/CTO partnership.
- Good venue to operationalize governance, reliability, and AI productization in a smaller org.
- Company scale is below your usual enterprise sweet spot, but scope is end-to-end tech leadership.

title: Head of Engineering (Platform)
shortDescription:
- Exec role reporting to CTO; lead Platform/Insurance group (eligibility, claims, billing, payments).
- Own org design + scaling multiple engineering pods.
- Emphasis on reliability/security in complex regulated domains.
- Mentions growth from ~150 to 250+ engineers.
fitRationale:
- Strong platform exec role with compliance-ish domain complexity (insurance/payments).
- Direct match to scaling high-impact platforms and operating model design.
- Not classic enterprise software, but the platform + regulated complexity fits your themes.

title: Sr. Director, Data Platform Engineering & Operations
shortDescription:
- Lead SIE’s Data + AI platform ecosystem (streaming/ingestion/warehouse, governance/observability).
- Operate at massive scale (millions of users; billions of data points/day).
- Stack mentions: Kafka, Databricks, Snowflake; governance tools (Alation/Collibra).
- Bay Area role (San Mateo).
fitRationale:
- Very aligned with enterprise-scale data/platform leadership + governance/observability.
- Strong bridge to AI platform strategy (Databricks/Snowflake + AI/ML adoption).
- Big-org, cross-functional exec leadership similar to your OpenText scope.

title: Chief Architect
shortDescription:
- Transformation role: lead multi-year modernization from monolith to AWS cloud-native microservices.
- Own architectural governance (standards, decision-making, review) and exec-level roadmap translation.
- Guide parallel-run migration strategy (legacy + modern), balancing tech debt vs new capabilities.
- Partner with security/ops/product; explicitly mentions AI-driven product capabilities.
fitRationale:
- Strong fit for your platform modernization + governance + executive alignment strengths.
- Cloud-native architecture leadership with clear value on operating model + standards at scale.
- Good narrative for ‘trust at scale’: migration, reliability, compliance, and AI capability delivery.

title: Senior Vice President of Data & Infrastructure
shortDescription:
- Report to CTO; oversee 80–100 engineers across data infrastructure (ingestion, prediction, measurement, exchanges).
- Own build/buy/partner strategy for data + infra; drive impact across ambiguous problem spaces.
- Lead a US-based remote engineering org with strong cross-functional collaboration.
- Healthcare context (quality + cost outcomes) implies high governance/privacy requirements.
fitRationale:
- Very aligned to enterprise data platform leadership + AI/analytics enablement at org scale.
- Strong ‘data as product’ leadership role with room to shape governance, standards, and execution rigor.
- Domain is healthcare (regulated), which matches your governance/compliance focus.

title: Chief Technology Officer
shortDescription:
- Unify and modernize a 17+ product portfolio into a single scalable, cloud-first, AI-enabled platform.
- Lead a globally distributed engineering org (150–500+ engineers) across multiple hubs (US/India/Europe).
- Drive platform simplification, engineering KPIs/operating cadence, and cost/quality improvements in a PE-backed environment.
- Be customer-facing with enterprise accounts; support future M&A diligence and integrations.
fitRationale:
- Strong match to platform consolidation + architecture governance + operating-model work at scale.
- AI-enabled platform shift + multi-product unification is a clean ‘enterprise transformation’ narrative.
- PE value-creation framing (EBITDA, cost/velocity metrics) aligns with “trust + performance at scale” execution discipline.

title: Chief Architect
shortDescription:
- Define architectural vision + prioritize platform-level investments; report to CTO and partner with VPs of Engineering.
- Architect scalable SaaS + cloud-native systems including data platforms that support AI/ML workloads at scale.
- Embed responsible AI (fairness/transparency/privacy) + data governance + model lifecycle management from design to deployment.
- Establish and enforce architecture standards, policies, and best practices across engineering/IT/security.
fitRationale:
- Direct hit on responsible/ethical AI + governance + platform modernization (your core ‘trust at scale’ theme).
- Strong cross-functional enterprise architecture scope (engineering + IT + security) with standards and decision forums.
- Tradeoff: smaller than mega-enterprise, but the architecture + AI governance mandate is unusually explicit.

title: Chief Architect
location: Remote (US) / St. Louis, MO / Boston, MA / New York, NY
shortDescription:
- Shape multi-year enterprise architecture roadmap across apps, data, cloud, integrations, security, and infrastructure.
- Lead modernization: cloud migration, API-first patterns, legacy rationalization; hands-on pattern/reference implementation validation.
- Own integration strategy across wealth platforms (portfolio/trading/rebalancing) and enterprise data platforms.
- Drive data governance, security, compliance, resiliency, and vendor/build-vs-buy decisions.
fitRationale:
- Strong enterprise architecture + governance role in a highly regulated, audit-heavy domain (finance).
- Integration-heavy platform scope fits your strengths in interoperability, standards, and operating model rigor.
- Good “sovereignty + compliance + platform modernization” story, even if the product domain is wealth tech vs enterprise SaaS.

title: Vice President, Engineering
shortDescription:
- Lead engineering through next growth phase; report to SVP of R&D and scale execution across product/platform/AI domains.
- Balance rapid iteration with foundational platform + infrastructure investment.
- Drive technical decision-making in support of AI and data initiatives; build leadership bench and org structure.
- Partner cross-functionally and be customer-facing for enterprise deals.
fitRationale:
- Good fit for scaling platform + AI capabilities and installing operating cadence/metrics in a fast-growth SaaS org.
- Customer-facing enterprise enablement angle aligns with translating technical strategy into GTM outcomes.
- Tradeoff: smaller company than your preferred enterprise scale; consider if you want higher leverage and broader end-to-end control.

title: Chief Technology Officer (Star-Trac)
shortDescription:
- Set product + technology vision/roadmap; report to CEO and align business goals with technology and market demands.
- Lead software development, QA, implementation consulting, and cloud delivery for a supply-chain event management platform.
- Own architecture/specification for a state-of-the-art SaaS solution; optimize performance and security; set KPIs.
- Operate in a buy-and-hold enterprise software platform (Banyan) with cross-company collaboration and transformation scope.
fitRationale:
- Real-time supply chain monitoring + large data volumes is a strong platform/data narrative (eventing, observability, reliability).
- Good fit if you want a CEO-facing CTO mandate with both product strategy and execution governance.
- Tradeoff: not US-based and more vertical-market SaaS; still relevant if you want “enterprise outcomes via platform modernization” in a new domain.
